All Rights Reserved.Is it the environment? Several environmental factors have been demonstrated to increase risk -Exposure to air pollution during pregnancy -Valproic Acid taken during pregnancy -Rubella exposure during pregnancy Others have been studied and ruled out -Anti-depressants taken during pregnancy -Pet Shampoo -Ultrasound Environmental Factors currently being studied -IOM identified over 80 toxicants worthy of study Flame retardants to pesticides Focus is on prenatal (2ndtrimester) exposure © 2009 Autism Science Foundation, Inc. All Rights Reserved.8 Page 22 © 2014 Autism Science Foundation. All Rights Reserved.What do we know about causes? For most of ASD, combination of genetic and environmental factors 15% of autism attributable to specific genetic causes -Genetically-defined autisms. Fragile X syndrome, Tuberous Sclerosis, IDIC15 and Phelan McDermid all have >60% diagnosed autism Imaging Studies and Genetics converging on neural synapses -"Synaptopathy"1 -common feature in above disorders -Formation and Function - genes regulating brain cell outgrowth, connections Synaptic Protein Discoveries Leads to Novel Therapeutics -Animal Models of Autism -Clinical Trials in Humans (arbaclofen, oxytocin) © 2009 Autism Science Foundation, Inc. All Rights Reserved.1.Brose, N et al. (2010) Synaptopathy : dysfunction of synaptic function? Biochem Soc Trans. Page 23 © 2014 Autism Science Foundation. All Rights Reserved.What do we know about biology? Differences in brain structure seen as early as 6 months of age, prior to symptom onset1. Altered brain activity is also seen prior to onset of behavioral symptoms Postmortem data indicate that brain structure differences originate in gestation2. There is an overproduction of brain cells in the frontal lobe, creating patches of functional abnormality. "Failure to prune" Have discovered genes responsible for "dysregulation" or failure to govern and sort the number of cells generated. This new knowledge is essential to developing early biomarkers of risk to autism as well as biological methods to improve diagnosis. © 2009 Autism Science Foundation, Inc. All Rights Reserved.1.
